title: NA Challenger Series 2018?
body:
With Season 8 of the NA LCS quickly approaching, and the introduction of the new franchise system, fans are getting excited... or at least I am. One piece of the new system that I feel is getting little attention is the challenger series. Each LCS team is required to maintain a full challenger roster, as sort of farm system for new talent.

Will the CS be streamed? What is the CS schedule for competitions? What are the names for the CS teams?

I hope Riot gives us more information and fully covers the CS. Seeing talent grow and then seeing those players in the LCS will be a great way to expand the fan base.

replies.body:
We are into that too - I think the story lines that the Academy League creates are going to be great. You should hear more about schedule and format in the next week or two. 

Until then, we are not requiring teams to have an "Academy Roster" - instead, teams will have one general roster and every week the teams will designate which players are eligible for LCS and which are eligible for Academy. We think this roster flexibility provides the best possible situation for teams and pros and promotes the kind of fluidity (is that a word? I think it is...) between rosters that we've been looking to encourage. 


--Grza (NA LCS League Ops)
